message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with the problem of reconstructing a polygon from its edges, which is a classic problem in computational geometry. The problem is known to be solvable in O(nlogn) time for arbitrary or simple polygons, which suggests that it belongs to the computational geometry (cs.CG) sub-category. The paper also discusses the NP-completeness of the problem for weakly simple polygons, which is a result in the area of computational complexity (cs.CC). The paper presents algorithms with linear time complexity for reconstructing weakly simple polygons in certain cases, which suggests that it belongs to the data structures (cs.DS) and algorithms (cs.DM) sub-categories. Finally, the paper also discusses related problems such as finding the minimum number of subdivision points or the minimum total length of added segments, which suggests that it belongs to the graph theory (cs.GT) sub-category.
